Naming teams/naming decks
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Card & Adventure Video Games: Monster Rancher Battlecard Episode II Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Naming teams/naming decks
By torey_luvullo on Tuesday, August 29, 2000 - 04:34 am:

i'm a little confused over the names ive seen posted lately for player's decks, both real people and game characters. i have a deck i always use with my troisamies team; does that make it my troisamies deck? or does there come a point in the game when you actually name the deck either the same as your teams name, or something different?

fj, trickster, eagle, tony - when you are talking about your deck/recipe by name, is that name the same as the team which uses it? or do you give the deck an independent name?

By Tony on Tuesday, August 29, 2000 - 05:28 am:

when I refer to a recipe/team/deck by a name, I refer to it as 3 monsters that have been demolishing the competition. I think where you're questioning team name, may be in Championship Cup when Pabs tells you that you need a team name, and you give them a name. I see that as useless. All it does is show a name in the brackets for the tourney.

By torey luvullo on Tuesday, August 29, 2000 - 09:50 am:

thanx tony - thats what i thought, but its good to have it confirmed.

By Eagle_Fierce on Tuesday, August 29, 2000 - 11:12 am:

I'm the same as Tony. "Romantic Flair" and "New Blackout," my two champion teams, are groups of monsters that I thought compatible and put together. I use one name for the Championship Cup, even though I have to register it every year..."Rending Wing."

However, if you WANT to switch a member of the team out, just go to "Reformation" under the "Cards" option. Here, you can change the deck as much as you like without scrapping a single record. Technically, you could have 100 wins, 0 losses, and change the entire deck while keeping the records. I've accidentally done this before, and that's why I don't post records. In the beginning, I had forgotten who won what!..hahahah

By Farmer Jimbo on Tuesday, August 29, 2000 - 12:06 pm:

Yep, "Plant Fire" is just the name I gave the deck during the reformation process. It was either that or "Burning Bush!" During the latest Champions Cup I named our team Evil Roots.

By torey_luvullo on Tuesday, August 29, 2000 - 12:13 pm:
